hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Transition on Regulatory News Volatility Spike
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regime, major regulatory news (MiCA implementation, US legislation) causing >25% increase in BTC 10-day implied volatility (Deribit) without corresponding price trend (>2% move) leads to BEAR regime transition within 2 days with 76% probability.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility spikes on regulatory uncertainty without price discovery indicate market confusion and potential for breakdown. Options markets pricing in tail risk that typically materializes as bearish momentum.
entry_conditions: Major regulatory news event (categorized by news sentiment <-0.4)
BTC price remains within ±2% range during volatility spike

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime transitions to BEAR (confidence >65%) OR 7% price decline from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: IV collapses back to pre-news levels within 24 hours

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 35% of such volatility spikes resolve with IV returning to baseline and price breaking upward, transitioning to BULL instead of BEAR.
